metadata.feature_description: Configure profanity handling across all modules with options to filter content, prohibit content, or allow all content.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Set profanity filter to 'Filter Content' (mask profanity)

steps.action: Navigate to Admin > Settings > Community Settings
steps.expected: Community Settings panel opens showing Profanity Filtering dropdown
steps.actual: Community Settings panel opened with Profanity Filtering dropdown visible under 'Miscellaneous Community Settings' section

steps.action: Select 'Filter Content' from the Profanity Filtering dropdown
steps.expected: 'Filter Content' option is selected in the dropdown
steps.actual: 'Filter Content' was successfully selected from the dropdown

steps.expected: Settings are saved and success message appears
steps.actual: Success notification 'Item successfully saved.' appeared confirming the setting was saved

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Set profanity filter to 'Prohibit Content' (block submission)

steps.action: Select 'Prohibit Content' from the Profanity Filtering dropdown
steps.expected: 'Prohibit Content' option is selected in the dropdown
steps.actual: 'Prohibit Content' was successfully selected from the dropdown

steps.expected: Settings are saved and success message appears
steps.actual: Success notification 'Item successfully saved.' appeared confirming the setting was saved

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Set profanity filter to 'No Filtering' (allow all)

steps.action: Select 'No Filtering' from the Profanity Filtering dropdown
steps.expected: 'No Filtering' option is selected in the dropdown
steps.actual: 'No Filtering' was successfully selected from the dropdown

steps.expected: Settings are saved and success message appears
steps.actual: Success notification 'Item successfully saved.' appeared confirming the setting was saved

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify profanity filter setting persistence after page reload

steps.action: Reload the page after saving 'No Filtering' setting
steps.expected: Page reloads and navigates back to Community Settings
steps.actual: Page reloaded successfully and Community Settings panel was accessible

steps.action: Verify Profanity Filtering dropdown value after reload
steps.expected: 'No Filtering' should still be selected after page reload
steps.actual: 'No Filtering' remained selected after page reload, confirming settings persistence

observations: The Profanity Filtering dropdown has three options: 'Filter Content', 'Prohibit Content', and 'No Filtering'
All three profanity filter modes can be successfully selected and saved
Settings persist correctly after page reload
Success notifications appear after each save operation
The default value for this installation was 'Prohibit Content' (not 'No Filtering' as mentioned in the feature description for new installations - this may be because the installation is not new)

Testing actual profanity filtering behavior would require creating content with profanity in a community module (Discussions, Ideas, etc.) which was outside the scope of this settings configuration test
